Reviews.Title: “Great value”
Reviews.Author: Erin S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Excellent location near many restaurants and shops, the staff were pleasant, breakfast was tasty, and the room was a great value all around. Near to the Pimlico stop and several bus stops for ease in getting around the city. Would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here”
Reviews.Author: Violet0000
Reviews.Content: This hotel was horrible- even for it's low price. There were no lifts (I had to lug my suitcase up about 6 flights of stairs), the toilets and shower were not working on my floor so I had to walk down to the second floor, the room smelt terrible and was so small that my suitcase took up most of the floor. It is also about 10 minutes walk to victoria station. Your money is better spent somewhere else

Reviews.Title: “budget stay”
Reviews.Author: Boris E
Reviews.Content: the location is just few minutes from Victoria station, which promises very good tube connections. there are supermarkets and restaurants nearby. the room was small, but very clean, facing the street, which was very quiet always. the only draw back was that the shower is outside the room, but I knew that already from the reservation, so was prepared. the breakfast is just the minimum of the minimum, but the worst thing is that on weekdays it finishes at 09:00am(!!!!!!). usually, you want to sleep in on a vacation..

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in a central location”
Reviews.Author: zehra g Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised with the Caswell. The location was good for us as we arrived by coach at Victoria and was able to walk there in about 10 minutes. We had a quadruple room as we travelled with our two young children. The room was clean, quiet, warm (a bit too warm actually), and the beds were nice and comfortable. The gentleman on reception was very helpful, gave us directions and advice with confidence and was happy to store our baby's milk in their fridge and warm it up when asked. Overall, a nice place comfortable place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you are not in your hotel much”
Reviews.Author: Entheniel
Reviews.Content: We stayed here back in 2010 actually, but at the time I forgot to write a review. I had nothing to do in the matter of picking what hotel we were at for this trip, so went in rather sceptical. You can get better hotels in London, without a doubt. And I would recommend i.e. Montana Excel over this any day of the week, but if you are in London for a weekend trip or so, and you just need a place to sleep and are not going to be hanging out in your room, this is a OK place. You share a toilet with the other guests, and the door is locked at most times downstairs, so you might have to wait until the receptionist is done on the phone to get inside, but all in all there are worse places. We were in London just to have a OK place to travel from, as we were only there for three days to check out universities for me. So we did not require a palace. This is not the place for a romantic city-trip, nor for a family vacation, but if you go by yourself or with a small group of friends and as said only need the roof over your head, you will be fine. Bring a map though. This is not the easiest place to find.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have stayed in”
Reviews.Author: stany_boyDublin
Reviews.Content: While this was a budget hotel they were charging us over 150 pounds per night over the new year. The rooms was of low quality and I actually feel grateful that we did no go away with bed bugs from this place. The room was run down with basic furniture and nasty pillows. Staying here was like over paying for a bad hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Worst review I've Written”
Reviews.Author: TexasDoug1
Reviews.Content: While every place we stayed was budget, this was the worst because of the service, quality of room, and price. This hotel is one of probably a dozen or more all connected along Gloucester Street. The location is OK. When we arrived, the clerk claimed they never received our reservation and rate guarantee (he waved a stack of faxes as thick as a phone book at me claiming their file system was flawless and they had not received my reservation). He then tried to charge us twice what I had been guaranteed for a two night stay. Fortunately I had an electronic copy in my laptop, and after demanding to speak to the owner, an hour later the owner agreed to honor the guaranteed rate. Had it been earlier, I would have sought other lodging. Small rooms, no lift (all rooms upstairs and very small stairwell), poor breakfast, and a dingy run down appearance. You might as well spend a little more, because you may not get the rate you expect, and the accommodations are disappointing. (As a note, Coolstuff10 must be the owner - no one else could have been that satisfied with, or that defensive of, this hotel).

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what you get”
Reviews.Author: Beingnotdoing
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very basic and seem to be furnished with substandard second hand furniture. The service is so so and cleanliness as good as it can be for a hotel that desperately needs a renovation and redecorating. Shower recesses very small. Location excellent in friendly pimlico.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: scona81
Reviews.Content: ok for one night stay, small room, shared toilet and bathroom, everything worked, basic but ok breakie.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: coolstuff10
Reviews.Content: Well! This is not Palace that you get Swimingpool in the room. Ofcourse if you order pizaa in london you have to pay Â£20.00 but this hotel is giving rooms with breakfast. I would say all other reviewers for this hotel need Physco medical treatment. This is perfect and what else you need for sightseeing.. Best part is Location and Reception staff.. fulll marks and sure will be retun next summer.

Reviews.Title: “worst hotel ever!”
Reviews.Author: drbutterfly_07
Reviews.Content: It was my first time in London, and I did not expect to experience such a horrible day in this hotel. The room was very small for its price value. The shower room was under renovation when my family and I arrived. They did not even provide basic toiletries such as shampoo/conditioner/toothpaste, that should have been available to a hotel with such a high price. The Manager was very rude. The Receptionist was not accommodating. They did not inform us that we should pay an additional charge when we checked in. Instead he constantly bothered us with additional payment at the middle of the night when we should have been resting already. We told him that we are willing to pay during check out in the morning but still insisted and threatened us that they will not allow us to stay for the night. Also the breakfast was not worth it. Because of this experience I will never recommend this hotel to any of my friends.

Reviews.Title: “the worst hotel in london”
Reviews.Author: elgatchie
Reviews.Content: I will not recommend this hotel to others because of our worst experience. They are not very accommodating. The toilet is not fixed when we arrived to check in. Somebody is still fixing the toilet while we are inside the room so we decided to leave the room and come back during the night because we cannot rest well. When we came back, we are forced to pay the bill for the extra persons. They won't allow us to pay our bill during check out in the morning. They did not even provide us with extra bed since the room was so small we can't fit in and it was very uncomfortable. Before we go there we even made a phone call to confirm our booking and told them that we are bringing extra person, they even promised to provide an extra room for us but unfortunately they did not. So we are forced to pay extra without providing us an extra bed or an extra room in the middle of the night or else they will kick us out of the hotel. How can you enjoy your stay in london and take a good rest if your hotel staff is like that? In addition, the breakfast is not that good, they only serve toast and cereals, they do not even a bacon or an egg. In totality, it was a very disappointing experience.

Reviews.Title: “Basic hotel for a good price in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: shellandlouis
Reviews.Content: I think this hotel has had a raw deal with it's reviews. Yes it is not the Ritz but for the price I paid it was a perfectly acceptable hotel. First some negative points so you know what you are getting. The hotel is dated and the decor is maybe not up to everyone's standards but it was clean and functionable with no bedbugs! We were on the top floor and there are a million steps to get up there with no lift so if you have mobility issues you may want to request a lower room. The room did get very hot but a fan was provided and the windows opened wide. We had a shared toilet and shower. The shower room was tiny (wardrobe size) with no space to change so you had to go to the shower in your towel, leaving your clothes outside. Not the best for my 3yr old child to use. However with all this when I am travelling I am only using my hotel as a base so all this was perfectly liveable. Now the positives. The staff were very friendly and helpful and didn't try to sell me anything. The hotel has free internet access and a 24hr reception, they also allowed me to leave my bags in recpetion on my last day in London free of charge. There was huge amounts for breakfast served from an open kitchen so you could see how clean it was served by friendly waitresses. The location is excellent within 5mins walk of Victoria Station and the tube and buses. We also had an easy walk to Buckingham Palace, Big ben, London eye, Downing Street and Westminster. There is also two musicals - Wicked and Billy Elliot - right next to Victoria Station so 5 mins from the hotel. However the hotel is located on a quiet residential street so I found it very quiet at night time but within easy reach of late night cafes or shops. The room was small but comfortable and clean with a mini fridge, hairdrier, sink, coffee/tea facilities and a TV with 5 analogue channels. The price I paid was excellent for central London and I wouldn't hesitate about going back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awful customer service”
Reviews.Author: alexuk75
Reviews.Content: i try booking around 25 times this hotel, and never received response... after call many times get some answer with not many interest, expansive hotel for share bathroom.. the only good is location

Reviews.Title: “Dreary, dowdy, depressing”
Reviews.Author: Andrew92
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming and polite, there was free internet access and the hotel is in a quiet location. But none of these things make up for the horrendously dreary state of the place, epitomised by a nasty carpet throughout. My room had old bits of furniture, a bed with springs sticking into my back, a poky plastic 'en suite', and a dusty smell. All this might be expected in a cheap hostel, but not in a hotel charging what this place does. You can do better!

Reviews.Title: “Even in a place like this I managed to get a...”
Reviews.Author: StayingInAHotel_Lad
Reviews.Content: ..bug in the room! Which was quite surprising considering the size of the room, the bug was cramped to be fair as was I and my partner for the evening. However, walking around London trying to find a hotel at 12.30pm, beggers can't be choosers so I'm quite glad the hotel was so bad that no one else wished to stay there! The few plus sides: the bar of soap said 'welcome' and there was a roof over the bed. Downsides include: broken kettle, one cup, telly with no aerial and furniture which oxfam wouldn't be allowed to sell on! It would have been cheaper to buy the contents of the room than to stay in it for the night. The verander was suprising however..

Reviews.Title: “Beware!”
Reviews.Author: sparsmakad
Reviews.Content: I admit my own mistake of not looking up this hotel on tripadvisor before my stay and boy did I regret that! Having stayed in plenty of B&B's and even worked in a couple I'm quite used to see several different standards and Caswell Hotel is below acceptable. My room was tiny with peculiar stains on the walls of god knows what and it wasn't particulary clean. The separate toilet was quite nice and looked recently done up. But if not desperate - keep looking for another accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accomodation with affordable price”
Reviews.Author: hazepavan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my friends for five days and i am very happy to give my feedback on this hotel.Caswell hotel is located in Victoria,London.Its stone throwing distance from hotel to many historical places such as Backingham palace,Hyde Park,House of Parliament,West Minister Abbey.Big Ben,London Eye,Tower bridge,Hard Rock Cafe etc.And also it is very close to the most happening places such as Piccadilly Circus,Leicester Square,Oxford Circus etc.Transportaion is very good from hotel to all other places in London. I had an excellent stay at this hotel.Cost of my stay was quiet cheap when i looked at facilities provided by hotel.Reception would be open 24hours and they are always ready to help you to make your trip successful.Hotel provides unlimited continental breakfast which is included in the bill.Finally,it is 100% worth staying in this hotel. I wish you a very happy trip and all the best for your stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience!”
Reviews.Author: xen72
Reviews.Content: We have been to this hotel - 8 persons (from 27 to 60 years old) in 2 quad rooms and I must say this hotel was CLEAN, presonal was VERY HELPFULL, breakfast was VERY TASTY, and NO BEDBUGS! Highly RECOMMENDED for anybody! Even the basement rooms are OK (I would say even better than the upper floors because of the heat in summer)! Don't be afraid, try it, You will be SATISFIED! Just one thing - as in every hotel - ear plugs are recommended, but not required - the sound of the Tube can be heard almost in every London hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hot, horrible, scummy sweatbox!”
Reviews.Author: Amy_R85
Reviews.Content: I stayed here after my staff party and it completely ruined the night. The room was so hot (even with the fan on full and the window wide open) we had to keep getting up to take cold showers. It hadnt been cleaned properly as there were asprin wrappers, stains and used train tickets around the room. The decor was something out of the 60's and the staff were rude. We had a Â£70 en-suite room, which you could hardly call an en-suite - it was more like a caravan sized bathroom plonked in the corner of the room. Their web-site is completely mis-leading - I would never stay here again and when I wrote to complain about the facilities, their response was all about having to pay 60p to use other toilets and I could have a 15% reward on my chosen date?? Avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Not Great!”
Reviews.Author: SmudgeiSzpagat
Reviews.Content: Hotel manager was nice and helpful when we had some complications with our card over the phone. The Hotel itself wasn't very inviting as we walked up the stairs to our room. Booked ensuite but when entering the room we found what at first glance looked like a cupboard however it was our bathroom and indeed it was a cupboard if we had wanted to we could have used the toilet had a shower and brushed our teeth in the wash basin at the same time! The room itself was clean and comfortable. The mini fridge had mould in it and the push up windows didn't stay up they kept falling down in the night. Didn't bother with the breakfast because the Chef didn't look too clean. Would recommend going to the italian inside Victoria station where they have an all you can eat buffet which was great value for money and the food was deilcious. The location was great not far from anything really and piccadilly circus was a lovely walk at night, one of the highlights of our trip! BE CAREFUL when the manager tries to fob you off with discount prices on the big red bus tour he doesn't save you any money at all you are better off booking it online or paying full price from the ticket vender. All in all not a bad place but not a great place either, will not be booking here again.

Reviews.Title: “A seasoned interior but if you are on a budget... ok!”
Reviews.Author: dellenin
Reviews.Content: I was given a room at the top floor, and phew... what a climb! I wouldn't suggest this for the elderly. On the top floor, the shower room is too small, and the toilet light is too dim. The overall interior of the single occupancy room looks seasoned, the bed needs to be replaced and so do the curtains. Having said that, I think this hotel is still not that bad. There is plenty of room for improvement. The staff are pleasant and efficient, even though they have to be around for 24 hours, due to the key-leaving rule that they have. Well, I would recommend this place for travelers who have a budget in mind. Seriously, it is quite OK in terms of location.

Reviews.Title: “Great location to Victoria Station with free internet, continental breakfast and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: americantraveler2009
Reviews.Content: I am always hesitant on any hotel I book without seeing it first. I am quite picky (learning not to be) but my main concern is that the lodging doesn't have bugs. I booked online for 2 nights and on arrival I asked to see the room before paying for the second night. The man was very accomodating. As stated before the room is quite small, toilet facilities and shower are in seperate rooms. The rooms has a tea kettle which was nice to make cup of soups and hot chocolate. Teas and cream were provided also. The tv got about 5 channels, it also included towels, the sheets were clean and I never saw a bug. We stayed on the second floor on the street and slept well. I felt safe in the area and a coupleblocks over was a grocery store with amazingly cheap food. It isn't far from the Victoria station and from where the Play "Wicked" is performed. We took Terravision from Stansted to Vicotria station and caught the Original Tour Hop on Hop off bus from right by Victoria station as well. There are many pubs and eateries close by. It was a very good experience. The staff was very pleasant and very helpful. I would stay here again. The only thing that I would recommend is that they use some bleach in the showers (looks like mold on the tiles.) I would also like to see them wipe down the walls and baseboards as there is a lot of build up of dust , dirt, and liquids. But I kept myself away from it...I did purchase antibacterial wipes to clean it up myself but we were never in the room long enough to clean it up. Overall I would stay again. BTW I paid 55 pounds a night for two adults. Another thing that is a definite plus...free internet and free continental breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: LouSut
Reviews.Content: Having reada few of the reviews of the hotel two days before I travelled I was really quite worried about what I would find. On arrival, however, I was pleasantly surprised. Our room was on the ground floor and had two comfortable double beds, an adequately sized wet room with toilet, shower and wash basin, a kettle, hair-drier and TV. There was a good-sized wardrobe in which I quickly stored all our clothes (four of us there for five days) and there was still room to spare. The location was perfect. Just a two minute walk from the shops and restaurants and five minutes to Victoria station. All that and yet the street was very quiet; hardly any traffic and not much pedestrian noise. My only complaint was that we had to have the window open all the time due to the heat, though that was hardly their fault, it was a hot week. There was a fan in the room (not air-con) and combined they were sufficient to keep the room at an acceptable temperature. We only ventured down to breakfast on three mornings and found friendly staff and a small but servicable dining room. The toast and croissants were fine and the coffee was as coffee should be. There was a selection of cereals and fruit on offer and the lack of full english breakfast was made up for by the location of a fab cafe two minutes away (the name of which has, unfortunately slipped my mind). Overall we had a good week in London and would happily go back to the Caswell on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Friendily, cheap, tiny but centrally located”
Reviews.Author: itzehoe
Reviews.Content: This family run hotel is just 8 minutes away from Victoria station and well situated from travellers taking the bus from Stansted airport, as we did. Tiny rooms that were clean and for London an excpetable price of 65 pounds per night in a double including breakfast. Free WiFi was also nice to have!

Reviews.Title: “I would rather stay with norman bates”
Reviews.Author: hotelinspector2009
Reviews.Content: If you just want a basic bed for the night then you cant complain...well you can as you dont get a bathroom. if you request one like me its the size of a tube of smarties and the door is basically a wooden shutter with no lock. This is more like a hostel were its just a base to throw your stuff in. You have to leave your key at reception when you go out and there is no were to keep valuables so be wary. The hot water didnt work in the "shower" and there was only a tiny bit of toilet roll so i had to borrow some from the communal toilet (sorry about that). Take advantage of a cup of tea in the morning from your room as the breakfast is a huge dissapointment. You can have cerial or toast. The toast was basically a load of sliced bread lol not even a tiny bit toasted, was laughing too much to complain and believe me il eat any old stuff. The teapot contained one teabag lol and came out like white milky water! theres hundreds of bed n breakfasts along that road, dont bother with that one.

Reviews.Title: “No good”
Reviews.Author: danielcraig22
Reviews.Content: Dump ,i felt like i was staying in chernobyl - the room was TILTED to the right, you couldnt open the door fully because it was blocked by a wardrobe (which was so small you couldnt fit clothes in), the sink was clogged, tv had 4 channels and very very poor reception (with antennae), the bed was VERY worn and springs were poking me all night, the window didnt close, all the furniture was about 50 years old i think, it also had the oldest water heater i have ever seen, amazing taht it worked tho it was very rusty, the chair in the room was extremely filthy had to cover it with a towel, and the free wifi? dont bother, very slow, very bad reception, disconnected all the time. Basically dont be stupid and avoid at all costs!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Exprience!!”
Reviews.Author: Jolly27
Reviews.Content: On Bigining of the May Me and my Family have stayed in this hotel! Well When I arrived to the hotel, I found that one of the member of staff has open the door with nice and wellcome smile, He gave us all the detail on check in incuding Area information,Nearest tube station,Directon to the Victoria and all famous tourist vising Places. He gave us free map of worth 2.95 for street guide." ." So Me and my wife made plan for next day." Second thing i like that was nice breakfast. Breakfast include Fruits,Juces,cerials tea-coffee and Crossants. That's i wasn't expected. so over all i personally feel which was more than i booked. Another main point i would descrbe is location.It exctly central and safe neighbourhood. Hotel is safe due to main doors operated by recepcionist permission only. I also will give less point will be no lift in the hotel, so I have to hang up till 3rd floor. but its was not much more problem. I already have stayed in some other hotels in london but i found this is one of best from them.

Reviews.Title: “Stop! You may prefer a night in the Tower of London Dungeons”
Reviews.Author: TravelHardforfun
Reviews.Content: Hmmmm! I arrived with my two young children from the USA and tried to check into this hotel upon my arrival at 11pm. I did know in advance that I may not be able to check in until 1pm. However after a ten hour flight and 3 hour cab journey due to bad traffic we finallly arrived at the hotel. Upon our entrance which was a struggle to fit my suitcase and two children as well as myself through the hallway. The carpet was a dingy, stained and looked like it had been taken from a closing down well used restaurant from the 1970.s. The walls were a blend of dull green with brown marks which i presume was from so many people rubbing up against them trying to squeeze through. The reception was not much bigger and behind the unfinished, unpainted hand made MDF desk was a guy who I presumed to be the owner he was pleasant although not too understanding. Please note I could not fit myself as well as my children into the reception it was about the same size as my brrom cupboad. I then found out that the toilet and separate shower were two floors away from our room. We were only staying two nights there and we only needed something basic to crash for the night. Although I did not realise basic meant, dirty, grimey, dull, dingy, smelly. stained and the most repulsive place I have ever paid to enter. But it gets worse.... I asked if we could sit and wait with our luggage until our room was ready. But was told there was nowhere we could sit as he did not have anything. I asked if we could wait in the breakfast room but was told it was locked until breakfast the next morning. (Not sure how anybody could pluck up enough courage and anti- bodies to actually eat there?) He then went on to inform me that it was not a hotel but in fact a bed and breakfast, not sure what the difference is? I asked him why it said Caswell Hotel outside the door....he told me he didn't know. So we had to leave the hotel, as we were walking out he informed me I was not allowed to take our key and we had to leave it with him at all times as keys were not permitted beyond the front entrance. So we bravely left our luggage with him and went out until 1pm as requested. We returned to find that nobody was in the hotel and we had to wait for 15 minutes in the cold and rain for him to return to open the front door for us. He did apologise and said he was busy cleaning. My daughter was desparate to use the toilet and he showed us to the toilet on the second floor....this was going to be our toilet shared by two other floors of people. The door was difficult to open and then it could not close all the way, so if you were in action anybody going to their room could quite happily see, hear or smell what you were up to. The sink was so small I did wonder how you could put both hands under the tap? There was no soap but an abundance of fully used, soiled white and brown toilet paper all over the toilet floor. The inside of the toilet and toilet seat looked like it had just been in an explosive bomb made up of people's poo from all over London but there was a very nice clean toilet brush outside of the toilet entrance in the hallway. We did not use the toilet but had a quick look at the shower which we stupidly thought may also have a toilet! The shower did not look much larger than a circumferance of a toilet roll,,,i was trying to imagine as a size 10 female how you would actually fit into it without the fear of the sticky grungy moldy shower curtain clinging to your body. We all walked downstairs (be careful here they are not very wide or straight) and I asked to check out, he told me no problem but could not give me a refund as i booked through a website....funny the website has told me only he can give me a refund! This is the kind of hotel that you would recomend to a demolishion company and to the health and safety inspectors....nobody else especially if you have children or are over a size 12 (150 pounds) as you would not fit through the hallway or reception or shower...but that would be a welcome bonus. I walked across to a hotel just 5 minutes away called the Luna Simone it was a three star for the same price and was absolutely gorgeous...please stay here instead unless you like the hammer house of horrors touch.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and basic”
Reviews.Author: Sazara
Reviews.Content: The caswell is extremely dingy, needs a good paint, but if you are,like we were, just after somewhere fairly handy to put your head down for the night, its fine. The only thing is, its very noisy-we were woken up several times during the night by the noisy plumbing and slamming doors. However, the room was absolutly spotless, and the breakfast was basic but plentiful, and again, it was all very clean (crockery tables etc). The staff were very polite and efficient. Be warned however and maybe ask for a lower floored room as the stairs are lethal!

Reviews.Title: “got what I expected”
Reviews.Author: Spacetraveller07
Reviews.Content: Before travelling to London I had read many reviews telling that rooms in B&Bs are rather small. That is why I wasn't surprised when I arrived at Caswell. My mother and I booked an en-suite room two months beforehand. The manager had let us have a look at our room before we paid the whole sum of money. As to the room itself, it was small, but quite cosy. It looked very similar to the one shown on the photos provided by the hotel. Beds and towels were clean. The shower was rather small but we coped quite ok. We enjoyed the breakfasts in spite of the fact that there wasn't much variety. There was a good range of cereals, jams and very tasty croissants and toasts. Also, what I liked a lot, was that we had a kettle, a tea pot and tea and coffee bags in our room. Speaking about the location, it was quite convenient. It took about ten minutes to reach Victoria station and several minutes to reach a bus stop. There was a reasonably priced supermarket in the area as well. All in all we were quite happy with our stay in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not all is well at the Caswell”
Reviews.Author: Durbik
Reviews.Content: The Caswell offers some good and some bad points. Having stayed there for 5 nights, I feel somewhat qualified to comment, and , since I am a very forgiving and kind person, tolerant of much, I'll start with the positives. The Caswell is very conveniently located, within easy walking distance of Victoria bus and rail stations, the Pimlico Tube stop, Buckingham Palace, Parliment and the rest of the Westminster attractions, the Thames, etc. It has close-by internet cafes, laundrettes, restaurants, and other services. We felt very safe in the neighborhood, which is made up of private homes and hotels much like the Caswell - at least from the outside. The staff was very pleasant and helpful, courteous, and went out of their way to assist us whenever they could. On the negative side of the ledger - the place is a dump. The carpet is dingy and overworn, the furniture is stained and tired. When I tried to pull our desk chair out from the desk, the back of the chair came off in my hand. The rooms are small and cramped, and the walls and floors are not plumb - many items for furniture listed noticeably in one direction or another. The en-suite facilities looked to have been taken from an RV and stapled into the corner of our room. The WC was VERY small - but cleanish. It was hard to use the sink without kneeling on the commode. You couldn't move in the bathroom without bumping things, including the toilet paper holder, which routinely fell off the wall. The shower was so small that it was almost impossible to stand in it without the shower curtain clinging to you, which was kind of icky. Even though we had facilities in our room, we thought seriously about using the shower down the hall, just because it looked like you could bend over in it without clonking your head on the sink. The breakfasts at the Caswell are spartan - cereal, toast or croissants, juice and coffee or tea, but served by very charming and gracious staff, and everything in the simple breakfast room was very clean and tended to. If you are budget conscious, and only need a mostly clean bed to collapse into at the end of the day, maybe the Caswell is worth it. If anyone in your party is the slightest bit squeamish about stains and close confines, go elsewhere. There are dozens of similar hotels in the same neighborhood - I have to believe some of them are better appointed and better cared for. The net result of our experience is that we won't be going back, and won't recommend it to anyone we like.

Reviews.Title: “terrible experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: my sister and i reserved a double room after viewing their website. i should have checked it out before paying. we seriously contemplated staying up all night rather than sleep here. We were given a room downstairs, dingy, filthy stains on the carpet, and food stains on the quilt., bottomless drawers. we asked to change rooms and were forced to pay 8 pounds more for the upgrade. in this room i found a silverfish in my bed and hair, nail clippings on the floor. my throat hurt from all the chemicals being sprayed there (to kill bugs?) DO NOT BOTHER CHECKING THIS PLACE OUT.Its worth spending more money somewhere else to not have to put up with what we did.

Reviews.Title: “Paid, but did not stay!”
Reviews.Author: HoosierDeb
Reviews.Content: I arrived back into London late one night, and at the Victoria Station I decided to try lastminute That was a mistake, in my opinion. In fact, I hope someone from Lastminute sees this and has the heart to refund my money. I paid only 30 pounds...but that is at least 50 US Dollars $. Anyway, the girls who booked me the room were kind, and from what they said, the room sounded ok. I took a taxi to Caswell and went inside. The only nice thing about this Hotel was the young Indian boy who waited on me. The place was bad news. Dark, dirty, dreary...etc. I am an older woman who travels mostly alone, and I do not mind the majority of places I have ended up in, however, this was not going to be one of them. To start with, I would have had to walk up 4 flights to my room, which had no bathroom or telephone...both of which were important to me. My husband called every night from the States and I would lay in bed and talk. Mind you, It was 11pm in London when I arrived at this hotel. When I told the young man that I was not willing to climb the stairs (no elevator), He kindly tried to get me to go in the basement. It was a long flight of stairs also. There was a room down there with a bathroom ensuite. Witout going down I declined and left. I knew I would not get my money back. I then took a taxi to Westminster Hotel on Leinster square. I had stayed there several days before and I loved it. They took me right in...and honored a very low rate from the Internet. When you arrive somewhere late and tired you tend to take anything.

HotelInfo.Name: Caswell Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 25 Gloucester Street, London SW1V 2DB, England
